Weekly confirmed cases refer to the cumulative number of confirmed cases over the previous week.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Week by week change of confirmed COVID-19 cases
column3: The weekly growth rate on any given date measures the percentage change in number of confirmed cases over the last seven days relative to the number in the previous seven days.
Biweekly confirmed cases refer to the cumulative number of confirmed cases over the previous two weeks.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Biweekly change of confirmed COVID-19 cases
column3: The biweekly growth rate on any given date measures the percentage change in the number of new confirmed cases over the last 14 days relative to the number in the previous 14 days.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Estimate of the effective reproduction rate (R) of COVID-19
column3: The reproduction rate represents the average number of new infections caused by a single infected individual. If the rate is greater than 1, the infection is able to spread in the population. If it is below 1, the number of cases occurring in the population will gradually decrease to zero.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Cumulative confirmed COVID-19 deaths per million people
column3: Limited testing and challenges in the attribution of the cause of death means that the number of confirmed deaths may not be an accurate count of the true number of deaths from COVID-19.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Case fatality rate of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic
column3: The Case Fatality Rate (CFR) is the ratio between confirmed deaths and confirmed cases. During an outbreak of a pandemic the CFR is a poor measure of the mortality risk of the disease. We explain this in detail at OurWorldInData.org/Coronavirus

Daily new COVID-19 tests per 1,000 people
Daily new COVID-19 tests per 1,000 people
Daily new COVID-19 tests per 1,000 people
Tests conducted per confirmed case of COVID-19
column3: Shown is the rolling 7-day average. The number of tests divided by the number of confirmed cases. Not all countries report testing data on a daily basis.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: The share of daily COVID-19 tests that are positive
column3: Shown is the rolling 7-day average. The number of confirmed cases divided by the number of tests, expressed as a percentage. Tests may refer to the number of tests performed or the number of people tested – depending on which is reported by the particular country.

Total number of vaccination doses administered. This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).

COVID-19 Data Explorer: COVID-19 vaccine doses administered per 100 people
column3: Total number of vaccination doses administered per 100 people in the total population. This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).
This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Daily COVID-19 vaccine doses administered per 100 people
column3: This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).

Shown is the rolling 7-day average. This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Daily COVID-19 vaccine doses administered per 100 people
column3: Shown is the rolling 7-day average per 100 people in the total population. This is counted as a single dose, and may not equal the total number of people vaccinated, depending on the specific dose regime (e.g. people receive multiple doses).

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Number of people who received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine
column3: Total number of people who received at least one vaccine dose. This may not equal the number of people that are fully vaccinated if the vaccine requires two doses.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Number of people fully vaccinated against COVID-19
column3: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the vaccination protocol. This data is only available for countries which report the breakdown of doses administered by first and second doses.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Number of people vaccinated against COVID-19
column3: This data is only available for countries which report the breakdown of doses administered by first and second doses.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Share of people who received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccine
column3: Share of the total population that received at least one vaccine dose. This may not equal the share that are fully vaccinated if the vaccine requires two doses.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Share of the population fully vaccinated against COVID-19
column3: Share of the total population that have received all doses prescribed by the vaccination protocol. This data is only available for countries which report the breakdown of doses administered by first and second doses.

COVID-19 Data Explorer: Share of people vaccinated against COVID-19
column3: This data is only available for countries which report the breakdown of doses administered by first and second doses.

column7: Johns Hopkins University CSSE COVID-19 Data
column9: COVID-19 Data Repository by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University
column12:
Raw data on confirmed cases and deaths for all countries is sourced from the COVID-19 Data Repository by the Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) at Johns Hopkins University.

Our complete COVID-19 dataset is a collection of the COVID-19 data maintained by Our World in Data. It is updated daily and includes data on confirmed cases, deaths, hospitalizations, and testing.

We have created a new description of all our data sources. You find it at our GitHub repository here. There you can download all of our data.
